headline: Nvidia earnings, Fed minutes, MBS visit: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, November 19, including earnings results from companies like Nvidia (NVDA), Target (TGT), and Lowe's (LOW); the release of the Federal Reserve's October FOMC meeting minutes; and the second day of Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's trip to Washington D.C., where an US,-Saudi Arabia investment forum will see the attendance of several top CEOs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: TJX: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Framingham, Massachusetts-based company said it had profit of $1.28. The results topped Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.22 per share.

content.title: TJX: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: On a per-share basis, the Framingham, Massachusetts-based company said it had profit of $1.28. The results topped Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.22 per share.

headline: The TJX Companies, Inc. Reports Q3 FY26 Results; Comp Sales Growth of 5%, Pretax Profit Margin of 12.7%, and Diluted EPS of $1.28 All Well Above Plan; Increases FY26 Comp Sales Growth, Pretax Profit Margin, and EPS Guidance
summary: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., November 19, 2025--The TJX Companies, Inc. (NYSE: TJX), the leading off-price apparel and home fashions retailer in the U.S. and worldwide, today announced sales and operating results for the third quarter ended November 1, 2025. Net sales for the third quarter of Fiscal 2026 were $15.1 billion, an increase of 7% versus the third quarter of Fiscal 2025. Third quarter Fiscal 2026 consolidated comparable sales increased 5%. Net income for the third quarter of Fiscal 2026 was $1.

content.title: The TJX Companies, Inc. Reports Q3 FY26 Results; Comp Sales Growth of 5%, Pretax Profit Margin of 12.7%, and Diluted EPS of $1.28 All Well Above Plan; Increases FY26 Comp Sales Growth, Pretax Profit Margin, and EPS Guidance
content.summary: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., November 19, 2025--The TJX Companies, Inc. (NYSE: TJX), the leading off-price apparel and home fashions retailer in the U.S. and worldwide, today announced sales and operating results for the third quarter ended November 1, 2025. Net sales for the third quarter of Fiscal 2026 were $15.1 billion, an increase of 7% versus the third quarter of Fiscal 2025. Third quarter Fiscal 2026 consolidated comparable sales increased 5%. Net income for the third quarter of Fiscal 2026 was $1.

headline: S&P 500 slump, Nvidia earnings, Target & Lowe's: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are hovering in positive territory in Wednesday's premarket trading after the S&P 500 closed Tuesday lower for the fourth straight session, the market average's longest losing streak since August. Chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) is set to report third quarter earnings figures after the closing bell today. Retailers Target (TGT), Lowe's (LOW), and TJX Companies (TJX) are also out with their respective earnings this morning. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: T.J. Maxx Owner Lifts Outlook Again as Profit, Sales Climb
summary: T.J. Maxx parent  TJX  Cos. once again lifted its full-year outlook and logged higher profit and sales during the recent quarter, as the discount retailer continues to win over inflation-weary shoppers with its value and deals.  The company, which also owns Marshalls and Homegoods, now expects comparable sales to increase 4% this year, compared with a prior outlook of up 3%.  The company additionally raised its earnings outlook to $4.63 to $4.66 a share, from $4.52 to $4.57 a share.

content.title: T.J. Maxx Owner Lifts Outlook Again as Profit, Sales Climb
content.summary: T.J. Maxx parent  TJX  Cos. once again lifted its full-year outlook and logged higher profit and sales during the recent quarter, as the discount retailer continues to win over inflation-weary shoppers with its value and deals.  The company, which also owns Marshalls and Homegoods, now expects comparable sales to increase 4% this year, compared with a prior outlook of up 3%.  The company additionally raised its earnings outlook to $4.63 to $4.66 a share, from $4.52 to $4.57 a share.

headline: TJX Stock Rises as Earnings Beat Expectations. Why Off-Price Retail Keeps Winning.
summary: TJX  stock rose in premarket trading Wednesday after TJ Maxxâ€™s parent company posted a stronger-than-expected fiscal third quarter and raised full-year guidance, proving again the resilience of the off-price retail model.  TJX reported adjusted earnings per share of $1.28 for the quarter ended Nov. 1, topping analystsâ€™ projections for $1.23 a share, according to FactSet.  Total-company comparable sales rose 5% from a year ago, ahead of forecasts for a 3.7% increase.

headline: TJX is 'best positioned' among off-price retailers this holiday
summary: The Consumer Collective Co-Founder and Managing Director Jessica Ramirez discusses her firm's latest survey on what low and middle-income Americans are expecting to spend the most on this holiday shopping season, commenting on the retailers respondents find the most value at and why TJX Companies (TJX) could capitalize the most on off-price shopping. TJX is the parent company of the chain stores Marshalls, T.J. Maxx, and HomeGoods. Also catch Jessica Ramirez compare whether Walmart (WMT) or Target (TGT) will come out with an edge over the other this earnings season. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: TJX stock's 16 years of growth: Its future as bright as its rearview
summary: TJX Companies (TJX) raised its full-year profit forecast while beating third quarter earnings and revenue estimates. Even more notably, the Marshalls and HomeGoods parent company's stock has risen for 16 consecutive years and is on pace to close out 2025 with gains. Neuberger Berman senior research analyst John San Marco discusses what makes TJX unique and sets it up for success in the future. Also catch John San Marco's comments on Target (TGT) and the retailer's turnaround strategy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: TJX stock's 16 years of growth: Its future as bright as its rearview

TJX Companies (TJX) raised its full-year profit forecast while beating third quarter earnings and revenue estimates. Even more notably, the Marshalls and HomeGoods parent company's stock has risen for 16 consecutive years and is on pace to close out 2025 with gains.

Neuberger Berman senior research analyst John San Marco discusses what makes TJX unique and sets it up for success in the future.

Also catch John San Marco's comments on Target (TGT) and the retailer's turnaround strategy.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out moreÂ Market Catalysts.

headline: Lowe's Profits Top Estimates as TJX Raises Outlook
summary: Lowe's Cos. reported profit that topped expectations on a pickup in online sales and growth in demand from professional contractors. The results mark a minor bright spot in retailer results this week after competitor Home Depot cut its full-year profit target on Tuesday as consumers pulled back on bigger ticket purchases. Elsewhere, TJX Cos., which runs chains including TJ Maxx and Marshalls, posted sales above estimates last quarter, raising its outlook, and perhaps signaling that US shoppers are turning to cheaper options as the economy shows signs of stress. Bloomberg's Redd Brown and Lily Meier joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.

content.title: Lowe's Profits Top Estimates as TJX Raises Outlook
content.description: Lowe's Cos. reported profit that topped expectations on a pickup in online sales and growth in demand from professional contractors. The results mark a minor bright spot in retailer results this week after competitor Home Depot cut its full-year profit target on Tuesday as consumers pulled back on bigger ticket purchases. Elsewhere, TJX Cos., which runs chains including TJ Maxx and Marshalls, posted sales above estimates last quarter, raising its outlook, and perhaps signaling that US shoppers are turning to cheaper options as the economy shows signs of stress. Bloomberg's Redd Brown and Lily Meier joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.
content.summary: Lowe's Cos. reported profit that topped expectations on a pickup in online sales and growth in demand from professional contractors. Bloomberg's Redd Brown and Lily Meier joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.

headline: T.J. Maxx Owner Still Drawing Budget-Conscious Shoppers Ahead Of Holiday Season
summary: T.J. Maxx parent TJX Cos. said it expects a strong holiday season as the off-price retailer continues to win over inflation-weary shoppers with its value and deals.

summary: The company is doing well,catering to a more cautious customer base.
